name: Abnormal flags
description: Flags indicating abnormal, normal, or panic value results for laboratory and clinical observations

values.definition: Result is below the measurable range of the testing instrument
Result is above the measurable range of the testing instrument
Non-numeric result that falls outside normal parameters

values.description: Very abnormal (applies to non-numeric units, analogous to panic limits for numeric units)
values.definition: Critically abnormal non-numeric result requiring immediate attention
Result shows improvement compared to previous values
Result shows significant decrease from previous measurements
Numeric result above the upper normal reference range
Critically high result requiring immediate clinical intervention

values.description: Intermediate. Indicates for microbiology susceptibilities only.
values.definition: Intermediate susceptibility result for antimicrobial testing
Numeric result below the lower normal reference range
Critically low result requiring immediate clinical intervention

values.description: Moderately susceptible. Indicates for microbiology susceptibilities only.
values.definition: Moderate susceptibility result for antimicrobial testing
Non-numeric result within normal expected parameters

values.description: No range defined, or normal ranges don't apply
values.definition: Result for which normal reference ranges are not applicable or defined

values.description: Resistant. Indicates for microbiology susceptibilities only.
values.definition: Resistant result for antimicrobial susceptibility testing

values.description: Susceptible. Indicates for microbiology susceptibilities only.
values.definition: Susceptible result for antimicrobial susceptibility testing
Result shows significant increase from previous measurements

values.description: Very susceptible. Indicates for microbiology susceptibilities only.
values.definition: Highly susceptible result for antimicrobial testing
Result shows deterioration compared to previous values

notes: Essential for laboratory result interpretation and clinical decision making, includes both quantitative and qualitative abnormal indicators
